opening.line: Everything is going smoothly as the Aethon leaves earth orbit and starts its journey towards the small red dot that is Mars. The crew settles into their chairs on the command bridge.
“This has got to be one of the strangest missions I've ever had.” the Captain thinks to himself as he stares into the emptiness of the screen in front of him.
“Captain!” says the Scientist. “Our communications systems have gone offline!”
“Well that’s not very good. Lets see what we can do.”

opening.line: After the communications fiasco, things returned to a much more calm state on the bridge. The Captain begins to think again.
"I know that the terraforming of Mars is a big deal, but do they really need what we're carrying?"
He ponders that thought for a moment longer but the ideas in his head are interrupted by the wailing of the alarm again.
"What is it this time!" he barks to the crew.
"The computer is reporting a coolant leak in the starboard engine room, sir!" replies the Engineer."
"Well don't just stand there! Get it fixed!"

choice_one.line: ”If I'm quick I could get to the shut-off valve before the engine overheats."

pass.line: "On it Captain!" the Engineer yells as he races off the bridge.
He quickly runs into the engine room and start rotating the shut-off valve closed.
Finally the hissing coolant leak becomes silent.
"Coolant leak eliminated Captain" he reports as he returns to his station on the bridge

opening.line: The ship is now a lot quieter after the coolant leak was stopped.
"Finally I can get a chance to figure this out." thinks the Captain.
"I just don't understand how Terraforming is that dangerous. You'd think they'd be able to..."
"Captain!" the Pilot interrupts. "My navigation systems are reporting that we are lost!"
"Well this mission isn't going to be very successful if we can't figure out how to get to Mars"
"Can't you just point us at the big red dot?" jokes the Scientist. "It's the only thing out there!"
"It's not quite that simple!" the Pilot retorts. "We need to get this fixed."

opening.line: At this point the Captain is starting to question their mission.
"It can't be worth all this. This is just too much trouble for what we are doing."
The Gunner walks back to his station and says "You know guys, our food store aren't bad at all."
"I concur." replies the Scientist. "It's better than some of the food they served during my time at the South Pole"
"You were at the South Pole?" asked the Engineer.
"Yes. I practice my science at only the most remote places. Why else would I of taken this assignment?"
The Gunner grabs his stomach and vomits into a waste receptacle.
"Oh my! What could of caused that?" the Scientist wonders. "Food poisoning! I must act before the rest of the crew succumbs."

opening.line: Back on the bridge, the Captain sat in the command chair and rested his chin in the palm of his hand.
"I'm really beginning to think that things are getting out of hand."
"How much further can this ship...and this crew make it?"
At that moment the alarms begin blaring their obnoxious refrain.
"Again? When does it end?!"
"It's the engine, Captain. It's gone offline. I'll take care of it."

opening.line: The bridge of the Aethon is becoming a solemn place. The crew is growing tired of their endless trials.
The Captain sits slouched in his command chair looking down at his hands folded in his lap.
"We're cursed. The gods want our mission to fail." he mutters
The Pilot glances at the Captain momentarily and then rushes off the bridge.
"Go check on 'em Doc. This is taking a toll on all of us."
The Scientist found the Pilot sitting on the floor in the hallway outside the bridge.
He was pretending that his hands were ships, making engine noise as they swooped back and forth until the inevitably crashed on the surface.
"Pilot! What's wrong with you, man?" the Scientist asks.
The pilot ignores him for a moment but then looks up.
"I'm mad as hell!...and I'm not going to take it any more!" the Pilot screamed.
"Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!!!!!!!!!!!" the Pilot cried out as he leapt from the floor and ran down the hall.
"My god he's gone mad!" the Scientist thinks. "I've got to figure out how to deal with this!"

choice_one.line: ”I could refer to the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, 5th edition to determine the diagnosis."

pass.line: "Its gotta be in here somewhere" said the Scientist as he flipped through the many pages of the manual.
"Ablutophobia? That's not it. Agyrophobia? It's not that either. Anthophobia? Nope. Atychiphobia! That's it!"
The Scientist walks to where the Gunner is holding the Pilot.
"Now listen here. Atychiphobia is nothing to be ashamed of. We all feel it now and again."
"But you just can't let it overwhelm you."
"You're right Doc." the Pilot whimpered. "Just give me a couple minutes. I'll be fine."
